com.generalnegentropics.archis.utils
Class LogicalExpression

java.lang.Object
  com.generalnegentropics.archis.utils.LogicalExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class LogicalExpression
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Implements a logical expression that can be used for boolean logical evaluation

This class implements a logical expression of the following form:

var1<operator>var2[<& or |>var1<operator>var2]...

Operators are:

   = (or ==) - Equality
  !=         - Inequality
   >         - Greater than
   <         - Less than
  >=         - Greater than or equal to
  <=         - Less than or equal to
   ^         - Contains string
  !^         - Does not contain string

Parentheses can be used to enclose expressions, groups of expressions, or values in expressions. Brackets can also be used interchangeably with parentheses. The \ character can be used to escape anything.

Expressions are evaluated linearly.

Examples:
  somevariable==1
  (somevariable==1)||(someother>=2)
  somevariable==() (Is somevariable empty/nonexistant?)
  (somevariable)==(1) (Same as the first one)

This implementation is immutable and fully threadsafe, so evaluate can be called from multiple threads simultaneously. Behavior is very similar to MathExpression.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Adam Ierymenko
See Also:
